title: Paintings Help People in the Hospital

content.en: Hospitals are not fun. They can make people sad. But a woman in the U.S. is making hospitals nicer. She helps people who are very sick.
content.tw: 醫院常常是讓人傷心的地方，但美國一個婦人用自己的方式幫助病人，讓醫院變得更好。

content.en: Is she a doctor? No, she's an artist. She paints big pictures on the hospital walls. The paintings look like open windows. They are not real windows. But they look real.
content.tw: 她並不是醫生，而是一位藝術家，她在醫院牆壁畫上逼真的窗戶，還有美麗的風景。

content.en: Pictures of nature are outside the windows. One picture shows a river. Other pictures show green grass, pretty flowers, and trees. The artist also paints roads outside every window.
content.tw: 畫中的窗戶外面有河流、草地、漂亮的花朵和大樹，或是長長的道路。

content.en: The paintings make people happy. They can't go outside. They are too sick. But they can look at the pictures. In their minds, they can take a trip outside. In their minds, they can go on the roads.
content.tw: 這些畫讓病人很開心，他們生病不能出門，但這些插畫讓他們想像自己在大自然旅行。

content.en: The artist also writes nice words on her paintings. The words help people think about happy things. Painting for people makes the artist happy too. She was very sick before. But now she's better. So she's helping people who are sick.
content.tw: 畫家也在畫作寫上鼓勵的話語，她也曾經生病住院，現在則用繪畫幫助其他病人。

content.en: Paintings can make hospitals a better place!
content.tw: 畫作能讓醫院成為一個更好的地方！

vocabulary.preface: 這位藝術家用她的圖畫，安慰被疾病困在醫院裡的人。

content.text:
1. outside 在外面。
Hey, Nancy, what are you painting today? 南西，你今天畫什麼呢?
Nothing special. 沒什麼特別的。
Just the view outside my window. 就是窗外的景色。

2. pretty 美麗的。
Wow, it's so pretty! 真好看!
I love the green grass and the flowers 我喜歡那些綠草和花朵…
except that there's no such thing out there. 但是外面沒有那些。

3. artist 藝術家。
I'm an artist. 我是藝術家。
I wanted my picture to look nice. 我想要我的畫很好看。
Okay, then maybe you can add some trees. 好吧，那也許你可以加幾棵樹。

4. nicer 更好的。
It'll make your painting even nicer. 會讓你的畫更美。
You're right, thank you! 你說得對，謝謝!

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你可記住了? outside在外面 pretty美麗的 artist藝術家 nicer更好的

quiz.question: 2. Why does the artist paint?
options: a. To go on a trip

quiz.question: 3. What is true about the artist?
options: c. She lives in a hospital.

title: Saving Ring with Diamonds Given by Grandmothers

content.en: A man asked a woman to marry him. She said "yes!" He gave her a diamond ring. They were a very happy couple. The couple went to a beautiful garden. They wanted to take pictures. They were ready! They smiled.
content.tw: 一位男士拿出鑽石戒指，向女朋友求婚，他們非常快樂地到花園裡拍照，紀念珍貴的一刻。

content.en: Oh! But there was something on the man's pants. The woman quickly brushed it off. But her ring came off too!
content.tw: 突然，女朋友注意到未婚夫褲子黏到東西，並且幫他拍掉，糟糕!她的戒指不小心掉下去了!

content.en: Where was the ring? It went down a drain. This drain takes away rainwater. Would it take away the woman's ring too? The couple was sad. The ring has diamonds from their grandmothers' rings. No other ring is the same.
content.tw: 戒指竟然掉到排水溝裡，這對情侶非常難過，因為那枚戒指的鑽石是用阿嬤的戒指的鑽石，全世界獨一無二。

content.en: They called for help. Firefighters came quickly! The firefighters looked down into the drain. They saw the ring! They carefully pulled it up. The woman didn't watch. What if the ring went down the drain again?
content.tw: 情侶趕快向消防隊求救，消防隊員看到水溝裡亮晶晶的戒指，準備撿起來，女孩太緊張根本不敢看。消防隊究竟會不會成功呢?

content.en: Five minutes later, the ring was safe! And the couple was surprised. The ring was shinier! Maybe some rainwater in the drain washed it…
content.tw: 五分鐘之後，戒指終於被撿起來了! 這對情侶非常驚喜，戒指竟然變得更加閃亮!也許是水溝的水讓它更乾淨。

content.en: The couple won't forget that day! And now they can live happily ever after.
content.tw: 這對情侶永遠不會忘記那天！現在他們可以永遠幸福快樂地生活下去。

vocabulary.preface: 訂婚戒指失而復得，讓這對情侶喜出望外!

content.text: 1. marry 結婚。Did you hear? 你聽說了嗎? Kevin gave Sarah a diamond ring last night! 凱文昨晚送給莎拉一只鑽戒! And asked her to marry him? 向她求婚嗎? That's great news! 真是好消息!
2. couple 一對。Yeah, they'll make a wonderful couple. 對啊，他們會是一對佳偶。They've been together for a long time. 他們在一起好久了。
3. ring 戒指。So he just gave her the ring, and she said "yes"? 所以他就送給她戒指，然後女方答應了? I don't know. I wasn't there. 我不知道，我不在場。
4. beautiful 美麗的。But I heard it's a beautiful ring. 但是聽說是很漂亮的戒指。Oh, Sarah will like it very much. 莎拉一定會很喜歡的。She said she was very surprised. 她說她很驚訝

vocabulary.postscript: 請來一起讀單字。marry結婚 couple一對 ring戒指 beautiful美麗的

quiz.question: 1. What did the ring go into?

title: A Spicy, Sour Soup Is a Country's Living Heritage

content.en: Tomyum Kung is a soup from Thailand. There's lime juice in it, so it's sour. There are hot chili peppers in it, so it's spicy! The "Kung" in "Tomyum Kung" means shrimp, so there's shrimp in it. There are other delicious things in it too.
content.tw: 冬蔭功是泰國有名的湯料理，因為有加萊姆汁和紅辣椒，所以它又酸又辣，裡面還有放蝦子和其他好吃的食材。

content.en: People say this soup is good for you. They say it gives you energy! Is it rainy and windy outside? They say Tomyum Kung is very good for you then!
content.tw: 冬蔭功對身體很不錯，很適合在颳風或下雨時喝上一碗，會帶給你滿滿的能量!

content.en: Thai people love Tomyum Kung. Some eat it with Thai rice. They eat it at home. They eat it in restaurants. They eat it outside!
content.tw: 泰國人超愛喝冬蔭功，他們會配上泰國米一起吃，在家裡、餐廳或是戶外吃!

content.en: Things that a country has or does for a very long time are its heritage. Thai people have made Tomyum Kung for many, many years. It's part of their heritage. Now the United Nations calls Tomyum Kung Thailand's living heritage!
content.tw: 一個國家長久以來流傳的事物，叫做文化遺產，泰國的冬蔭功有很長的歷史，因此聯合國將它列為泰國的活文化遺產!

content.en: Thailand is excited! It wants to share Tomyum Kung with the world. It wants everyone to come to Thailand and try it.
content.tw: 泰國很興奮，他們希望能將冬蔭功發揚光大，讓世界各地的人來泰國品嘗。

content.en: There is Thai food in Taiwan. Maybe you can try Tomyum Kung here! Maybe you'll love it too!
content.tw: 台灣也有泰式料理。你也許可以在這裡嘗試冬蔭功！你也許也會喜歡它！

vocabulary.preface: 泰式酸辣湯名聞遐邇，在台灣也吃得到。

content.text:
1. delicious 美味的。
Mmm, what is this? 這是什麼?
It's delicious! 真好吃!
You don't know? 你不知道嗎?
It's Tomyum Kung. ,這是冬蔭功，
the most famous Thai soup.

2. share 分享。
Is it easy to make? 很容易做嗎?
It's super easy! 非常容易!
Let me share the recipe with you.我來跟你分享食譜。

3. rice 白飯。
It's a bit too spicy, 有點太辣了，
but it goes very well with rice. 不過跟白飯很搭。
It does, doesn't it? 可不是嗎?

4. try 試一試或是品嘗。
Okay, I'll make this soup tomorrow. 好，我明天就來做這一道湯。
You must come and try it. 你一定要來品嘗。
I'd love to do that.

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡吃泰式料理嗎? 請來跟我一起讀單字。
delicious美味的 share分享 rice白飯 try試一試或是品嘗

quiz.question: 1. What country does Tomyum Kung come from?
2. What do people say Tomyum Kung gives you?
3. What do some people eat Tomyum Kung with?

content.en: Many plants have roots. Roots grow underground. Some roots are vegetables. Carrots and potatoes are root vegetables. Yams are big root vegetables!
content.tw: 你知道我們吃的一些蔬菜，像胡蘿蔔跟馬鈴薯，是其他植物的根嗎?它們在地底下生長，而好吃的地瓜就是一種大型根莖類蔬菜。

content.en: In India, Indigenous women are saving giant yams! A long time ago, their Indigenous group ate yams every day. Families cooked them in many ways. But now, the group eats yams less and less. The group eats rice and bread.
content.tw: 在印度，一些原住民婦女正在拯救大地瓜! 以前原住民族每天吃地瓜，但現在他們改吃米飯和麵包，地瓜變得不受重視。

content.en: The women want people to like yams and other root vegetables again. They find plants and grow them. They have found one hundred eighty kinds of root vegetables!
content.tw: 這些婦女希望大家重新愛上番薯跟其他根莖類蔬菜，所以她們總共找了 180 種根莖類蔬菜，並開始種植。

content.en: Growing root vegetables is hard work. The women dig all day. They use tools... and their hands. Some yams are taller than the women!
content.tw: 種根莖類植物很辛苦，要整天用工具跟雙手挖土。但她們很成功，有一些番薯甚至長得比她們還要高!

content.en: Sometimes monkeys and elephants eat the plants. Too much rain and heat are bad for the plants too. But the women don't give up.
content.tw: 有時候猴子跟大象會偷吃這些植物，印度的大雨跟高溫也對地瓜不好，但這些婦女從不放棄。

content.en: Every year, there's a big festival. It's about indigenous vegetables. The women show visitors their yams. These women are heroes! They are saving giant yams for everyone!
content.tw: 每年都會舉辦一個大型節慶，主題是關於原住民蔬菜。這些婦女會向遊客展示她們的地瓜。這些婦女是英雄！她們正在為大家拯救大地瓜！

vocabulary.preface: 這些原住民希望拯救大地瓜.

content.text:
1. rain 雨。
I spent 500 NT just on vegetables today! 我今天花了五百塊買蔬菜。
Yeah, they are getting more expensive. 對啊，蔬菜越來越貴。
There's too much rain. 雨下得太多了。

2. potato 馬鈴薯。
I should just buy carrots and potatoes.我應該只買胡蘿蔔跟馬鈴薯的。
Their price doesn't go up or down.它們的價錢不會忽上忽下。

3. eat 吃。
I remember the beef soup you made. 我記得你做的牛肉湯。
With carrots, potatoes and onions. 裡面有胡蘿蔔,馬鈴薯跟洋蔥。
It was so good! 很好吃呢。
I know. You ate a lot.我知道，你吃了不少。

4. hard 辛苦的。
Maybe I can grow some vegetables myself. 也許我可以自己種一些蔬菜。
That's hard work. 那很辛苦。
No, it's not. I've done it before. 不會，我以前種過。

vocabulary.postscript:
你記住了今天的單字嗎?
rain雨 potato馬鈴薯 eat吃 hard辛苦的

quiz.question: 2. What animals eat the women's yam plants?
3. How many kinds of roots have the women found?

title: Parks and Indigenous People Help Taiwan's Salmon

content.en: Taiwan has its own salmon! You can see them on the $2,000 Taiwan dollar bill.
content.tw: 台灣有種特別的鮭魚，叫做櫻花鉤吻鮭，你可以在兩千元鈔票上找到牠們。

content.en: The Formosan landlocked salmon are from the Ice Age! They live in mountain rivers. They cannot go to the ocean. That means they're landlocked.?
content.tw: 櫻花鉤吻鮭從冰河時期就存在！因為牠們只生存在陸地的高山河川裡，不能游到大海，所以牠們被稱為陸封鮭魚。

content.en: They're endangered too. Thirty years ago, there were 200 of these salmon! Their rivers were dirty. The dirty water was killing them!
content.tw: 這些鮭魚瀕臨絕種，三十年前只有兩百隻，當時的河水非常髒，所以鮭魚很難生存。

content.en: But... in 2023, there were 18,630 salmon! What happened?
content.tw: 不過在2023年，櫻花鉤吻鮭竟然增加到一萬八千六百三十隻，這中間發生了什麼事呢?

content.en: Shei-Pa National Park helps the fish. It cleaned the water in the rivers. It took things out of them too. Salmon can swim far now.
content.tw: 雪霸國家公園一直在幫忙這些魚繁殖，清除掉水中的垃圾跟障礙物，現在魚群可以在乾淨的水裡游很遠!

content.en: People help too. Many are Indigenous. They look for changes in the rivers. They keep these fish safe. They move baby salmon to higher, cooler rivers. Why? Climate change is making rivers too warm for salmon.
content.tw: 當地的原住民也有幫忙，他們觀察河水的變化、保護魚群安全，還把鮭魚寶寶移到水溫更低的河流，避免太溫暖的水傷害鮭魚。

content.en: Taroko National Park also helps. Now salmon swim in two rivers there!
content.tw: 太魯閣國家公園也加入這項工作，現在櫻花鉤吻鮭可以在兩座國家公園生活。

content.en: National parks and Indigenous people are working hard. They're saving Taiwan's endangered salmon!
content.tw: 國家公園和原住民們正努力工作。他們正在拯救台灣瀕臨滅絕的鮭魚！

vocabulary.preface: 櫻花鉤吻鮭是國寶魚，在高山溪流中可以見到。

content.text:
1. river 河流。
There's fish in the river! 河裡面有魚!
Yeah, they are salmon. 沒錯，是鮭魚。
Wow, salmon in Taiwan? 哇，台灣有鮭魚?
Yeah, isn't it wonderful? 是啊，很棒吧?

2. swim 游泳。
Do you know what I'm thinking? 你知道我在想什麼嗎?
You want to eat the fish. 你想要吃魚。
Spot on! 答對了!
You can't. They swim fast. 你吃不到，牠們游很快。

3. Ice Age 冰河時期。
They're from the Ice Age, you know. 你要知道牠們來自冰河時期。
Well, I prefer to eat hot, cooked fish. 我喜歡吃煮熟的，熱的魚。

4. go to 去。
Let's go to the eatery over there. 我們去那裡的小吃店吧。
They should have hot, cooked noodles.他們應該有煮熟的熱麵條。
Have you ever seen Formosan salmon?

vocabulary.postscript: river河流 swim游泳 Ice Age冰河時期 go to去

quiz.question: 1. Why are these salmon landlocked?
options: a. They cannot go to the ocean.
c. They live in the ocean.

quiz.question: 2. How many salmon were there thirty years ago?
3. What is one way Indigenous people help these salmon?

title: Where You Buy Bread Isn't Important

content.en: Mmm... Taiwan has delicious bread. There are many kinds! And bread is everywhere. You can find bread at bakeries. You can find bread at convenience stores.
content.tw: 台灣的麵包好好吃哦！在麵包店和便利商店都買得到各式各樣的麵包。

content.en: Is bakery bread better for you than convenience store bread? People are talking about this. They are talking on social media. They say bread from convenience stores is bad for you. Have you heard this? Well, this is not true!
content.tw: 人們在社群網站上爭論：麵包店的麵包有沒有比便利商店的健康呢？許多人說便利商店的麵包對身體不好，不過，這其實是迷思！

content.en: Doctors want you to know the truth. Where you buy bread is not important.
content.tw: 醫生們希望大家知道，在哪裡買麵包不重要。

content.en: Some things in bread make it last longer. People are talking about them. But very, very little is in bread. These things are okay for you.
content.tw: 人們擔心麵包裡會加一些化學物質讓麵包保持新鮮，但其實麵包裡很少防腐劑，不會對身體造成傷害。

content.en: People say some bread lasts for two weeks. They say this is not good. But bread lasts because... bread factories are very, very clean!
content.tw: 那為什麼有一些麵包可以放兩個禮拜這麼久呢？其實是因為麵包工廠非常乾淨！

content.en: And bread factories are very careful. They watch everything that goes into their bread.
content.tw: 他們非常小心，會確保沒有任何不好的東西跑進麵包裡。

content.en: So don't worry! Eat some delicious bread! Eat it with fruit, vegetables, or meat. That's good for you!
content.tw: 所以不用擔心哦！吃點好吃的麵包吧！你可以搭配水果、蔬菜，或者肉類一起吃，這樣比較好。

content.en: Buy bread at the places you like. But... don't wait two weeks to eat it!
content.tw: 在你喜歡的地方買麵包。但是...不要等兩個禮拜才吃！

vocabulary.preface: 很多人熱愛麵包，專家說趁新鮮吃比在哪裡買重要。

content.text:
1. bakery 麵包店。
Would you give me a minute? 你可以等我一下嗎?
I'd like to get some bread here. 我想在這兒買點麵包。
Here? 在這裡買?
Yeah. 對。
You should buy it at a bakery.你應該在麵包店買。

2. true 真的。
Why? 為什麼?
The bread there usually tastes better.那裏的麵包通常比較好吃。
That may be true, but I'm hungry now.也許是真的，不過我現在就餓了。

3. kind 種類。
The bakery I go to has many kinds of bread. 我去的那家麵包店有好多種類。
Toast, bagel, croissant…吐司,貝果,牛角麵包...

4. everything 一切。
They have everything here, too. 這裡也都有。
Enough talking. 我說夠了。
I just want to get my bread and eat it. 我只想去買麵包，然後吃掉。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡吃麵包還是吃飯? 來一起讀單字。
bakery麵包店 true真的 kind種類 everything一切

quiz.question: 1. What do doctors want you to know?
options: a. Where you buy bread is not important.
c. Convenience store bread is better.

quiz.question: 3. Why does bread last?
options: b. People eat it after two weeks.
